mdRecord.dcterms:description: "Electoral Board: Show Your True Colors!" - Author Unknown - The School Board Chairman has resigned and there is a call for a Black community member to be appointed. / "Selective Buying Campaign Ends" - Author Unknown -Selective Buying Committee voted to end the committee in light of a black person being appointed to the school board. / "Palmer? Deserved Rest?" - Author Unknown - The author slams an editorial in the Farmville Herald which applauds retiring school board member, George Palmer. / "Red Cross Denies Blacks Swimming Lessons" - Author Unknown - The Red Cross swimming lessons were canceled after seven black children tried to enroll. / "Editorial: The Blessing of Liberty to Ourselves and Our Posterity" - Author Unknown - A plea for the Black community to stop donating blood to the Red Cross until they can provide such things as swimming lessons to all. / "Whose Side Are You On, Boy???" - Author Unknown - The principal of Robert R. Moton is upset as the school shuts down for two days due to student protests. / "Perry Speaks to N.Y.C. (Neighborhood Youth Corps)" - Author Unknown - The new superintendent spoke with the Neighborhood Youth Corps to stress his commitment to the school system. / "Goldfish Found Dead" - Author Unknown - A humorous piece about two goldfish being found dead in T. Burwell Robinson's office sink.
